section.section: The Administration shall certify or cause to be certified ignition interlock systems for use in the State and adopt rules and regulations for the certification of the ignition interlock systems.
The Administration shall design and adopt a warning label to be affixed to an ignition interlock system on installation.

The warning label shall state that a person tampering with, circumventing, or otherwise misusing the ignition interlock system is guilty of a misdemeanor, and, on conviction, is subject to a fine or imprisonment or both.
The Administration shall publish a list of certified ignition interlock systems.

A manufacturer of an ignition interlock system that seeks to sell or lease the ignition interlock system to persons subject to the provisions of § 27-107 of this title in the State shall pay the costs of obtaining the required certification.

text.section:
A person may not sell or lease or offer to sell or lease an ignition interlock system to a person subject to the provisions of § 27-107 of this title in the State unless:
The system has been certified by the Administration; and
A warning label approved by the Administration is affixed to the system stating that a person who tampers, circumvents, or otherwise misuses the system is guilty of a misdemeanor, and, on conviction, is subject to a fine or imprisonment or both.

A person who sells or leases an ignition interlock system in the State shall:
Monitor the use of the system as required by the court; and
Issue a report of the results of the monitoring to the appropriate office of the Division of Parole and Probation.

The Administration shall adopt regulations establishing minimum standards for the certification of an approved service provider, including:
The minimum qualifications described under § 16-404.1 of this article; and
A requirement that an approved service provider shall maintain service and installation records and provide these records for inspection on the request of the Administration.
